translated: The Elder Sisters’ Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with the Elder Sisters who are Eighty Thousand
The Elder Sister Uppalavaṇṇā’s Birth Story
The nun Uppalavaṇṇā,
who has attained perfection in psychic power,
having worshipped the Teacher’s feet,
spoke this speech:

analyzed: nitthiṇṇā jātisasāra  patta aham acalam pada
translated: ‘I have crossed over the round of rebirths,🔽I have attained the unshakeable state;
I have exhausted all suffering,
I announce it, Great Sage.
As far as the assembly is concerned,
they have faith in the Victor’s Dispensation;
And whatever I have offended against,
may they forgive me in the presence of the Victor.
As I have wandered through the round of rebirths,
if I have made a mistake,
I announce it, Great Hero,
please forgive that offence.’
‘Please display your psychic power,
you who are one who acts according to my instructions;
Today the four assemblies,
please resolve their doubts.’
‘I am your daughter, Great Hero,
wise, radiant one,
I have done much difficult work,

analyzed: katam me ati dukkara  uppalassa iva me vaṇṇaḥ
translated: I have done what is extremely difficult.🔽I have the colour of a blue lotus,
my name is the one called Blue Lotus;
I am your disciple, Great Hero,
I worship your feet, O Visionary One.’
Rāhula and I,
in many hundreds of rebirths,
were born in the same existence,
with the same desire and the same thoughts.

original: Nibbatti ekato hoti,🔽jātiyāpi ca ekato;🔽Pacchime bhave sampatte,
analyzed: nibbatti ekataḥ hoti  ca ekatas  pacchime bhave sampatte
translated: We were born together,🔽and we were born together in our last existence,
but in our last existence we were of different births.
The son was named Rāhula,
and the daughter was named Uppalavaṇṇā.
See my psychic power, hero,
I show my strength to the Teacher.’
In the great ocean,
she threw the four (elements) into her hand-bowl,
and the oil that was in her hand,
like a child playing.
Having heated the earth,
she threw it into her hand-bowl,
like a young boy pulling out

analyzed: luñci komārakaḥ yuvā  cakka vāḷa samam pāṇi  chādayitvāna matthake
translated: the grass called muñja.🔽Having covered her head🔽with a hand like the world-sphere,
and having rained down on it,
she repeatedly (made it) of various colours.

analyzed: bhūmim udukkhalam katvā  dhaññam katvāna sakkhara
translated: Having made the earth a mortar,🔽and having made rice a pestle,
having made Sineru a pestle,
like the young girl Maddi.
‘I am the daughter of the Buddha, the best,
my name is Uppalavaṇṇā,
I have attained mastery over the higher knowledges,
I am a doer of what you have taught.
Having performed various miracles,
having shown the Leader of the World,
having announced my name and clan,
I pay homage at the feet of the Visionary.
I have attained mastery over the psychic powers,
and the divine ear element;
I have attained mastery over the knowledge of others' minds,
great sage.
I know my past abodes,
the divine eye is purified;
All the pollutants are destroyed,
there is no more renewed existence.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, and the phrasing,
and in ready speech as well;
My knowledge is pure and clear,
by nature, of the Great Sage.
The connection with the former Victors,
has been shown to you;
I have done much service,
for your sake, Great Sage.
The wholesome action that I have fulfilled,
please remember, Sage;
For as long as I live, Great Hero,
merit has been accumulated by me.
Having been restrained from the unwholesome,
preventing misconduct;
For as long as I live, Great Hero,

analyzed: cattam me jīvita uttama 🔽dasa koṭi sahassāni
translated: my supreme life is dedicated.
I gave my life,
And I was given to you,
For that purpose, Great Sage.’

analyzed: tadā ati vimhitā sabbā  sirasā ava katañjalī
translated: Then all the women,🔽With their heads bowed and hands respectfully placed,
Said: ‘How was it,
For you of incomparable psychic power and courage?’
For a hundred thousand eons,
I was a nāga maiden then,
Known by the name of Vimalā,
Considered virtuous by the maidens.
The great nāga, the great serpent,
Delighted in the Jina’s Dispensation,
Invited the greatly radiant Padumuttara,

analyzed: nimantesi sa sāvaka  ratana mayam maṇḍapa  pallaṅkam ratanāmaya
translated: Together with his disciples.🔽A jeweled pavilion,🔽A jeweled couch,
Filled with jeweled sand,
And a jeweled pleasure garden.
And he prepared the road,
Adorned with jeweled banners,
And going out to meet the Sambuddha,

analyzed: vajjantaḥ tūriyehi saḥ  parisāhi ca catūhi
translated: He played musical instruments.🔽And the Leader of the World,
Surrounded by the four assemblies,
Sat down in the great serpent’s abode,
On the supreme seat.🔽Food, drink, and solid food,

analyzed: bhojanañca  varam varam ca pādā asi
translated: And very expensive meals,🔽The nāga king offered,
The great serpent, of great fame.
Having eaten, the Sambuddha,
Having washed the bowl in a suitable way,
The one who was to be rejoiced in,
The Nāga maiden of great psychic power.
Seeing the Omniscient One fully awake,
The Nāga maiden of great merit,
The Teacher’s mind was full of faith,
and his mind was well-composed.
Knowing my mind,
the one called Jalajuttaman,
At that moment the Great Hero,

original: bhikkhuniṁ dassayiddhiyā.🔽Iddhī anekā dassesi,🔽bhikkhunī sā visāradā;
analyzed: bhikkhunim  iddhī anekā dassesi  bhikkhunī sā visāradā
translated: showed the nun his psychic power.🔽The confident nun showed many psychic powers,

analyzed: pamā uditā veda jātā  satthāram idam abravi
translated: and she was delighted and full of joy,🔽and she spoke this to the Teacher:
‘I have seen this psychic power,
and also the other Sumana.
How did she become, Hero,
so confident in her psychic power?’

analyzed: orasā mukhataḥ jātā  dhītā mama mahiddhikā
translated: ‘She was born from my mouth,🔽my daughter of great psychic power,
and she was confident in her psychic power,
because she followed my instructions.’
Having heard the Buddha’s words,
I made this aspiration then:
‘May I also become like this,
confident in my psychic power.
I was delighted and happy,
aspiring with the highest aspiration:
‘In the future, Leader,
may I become like this.’
On a jewelled seat,
In a radiant pavilion;
Having satisfied with food and drink,

analyzed: sa saṅgham lokanāyaka  nāgānam pavaram puppha
translated: The Buddha, the Leader of the World, together with the Saṅgha.🔽The supreme flower of the nāgas,
The red lotus named aruṇa;
‘May I have such beauty’,
I worshipped the Leader of the World.
By that good deed well done,
and by my aspiration and intention;
Having given up my human body,

analyzed: tau atisamagacchaha  tatas cutā aham manuje
translated: I went to the Tāvatiṃsa (heaven).
From there I passed away, and was reborn as a human,
I covered the Independent Buddha with lotuses,
and gave him almsfood.
For ninety-one eons,
the Leader named Vipassī,
who was beautiful to see,
the eye of all the world,
At that time I was the daughter of a merchant,
in the supreme city of Bārāṇasī;
Having invited the Sambuddha,
the Buddha, the Leader of the World, together with the Saṅgha.
Having given a great gift,🔽with lotuses I worshipped the Teacher;

analyzed: pūjayitvā cetasā ava  vaṇṇa sobham apatthayi
translated: Having worshipped with my mind,🔽I asked for beautiful complexion.
In this auspicious era,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,
called Kassapa by family,
appeared, the best of speakers.
The Great Sage’s attendant,
was then the Lord of Men;
The King of Kāsi was named Kikī,
in the supreme city of Bārāṇasī.
I was his second daughter,
afraid of the ascetic life;
But having heard the Victor’s Teaching,
I delighted in the going forth.
Our Father did not allow it,
so we remained in the house;
For twenty-thousand years,
we lived heedfully.
The youthful virginal life,
the King’s daughter well-nourished;
Delighting in attending on the Buddha,
the seven sisters were joyful.
The ascetic, the one afraid of the ascetic life,
the nun, the one who gave to the monks,

analyzed: dhammā ca iva su dhammā ca
translated: Dhammā and Sudhammā,
the seventh was the one who gave to the Saṅgha.
I, and the wise Khemā,
Paṭācārā and Kuṇḍalā;
Kisāgotamī, Dhammadinnā,
and the seventh was Visākhā.
By those well-performed deeds,
and by my intentions and aspirations;
Having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Having passed away from there, I was reborn among humans,
in a great family;
I gave yellow, smooth, excellent cloth
to the Worthy One.

analyzed: tatas cutāriṭṭhapure  jātāḥ vippa kule aha
translated: After passing away from there, I was reborn in Ariṭṭhapura,🔽In a very poor family;
I was the daughter of a cowherd,
Madantī, the captivating one.
After passing away from there, in a certain family in the countryside,
I was born as a slave in a not very wealthy family,
And at that time I was guarding the rice.

analyzed: disvā paccekasambuddha  pañca lājā satān iha
translated: Seeing the Paccekabuddha,🔽I gave him five hundred bunches of five-coloured rice,
Covered with lotuses,
And five hundred sons.
I made a wish, and they made a wish,
after giving honey to the Self-Existent One;
After passing away from there, in the forest,
I was born in the womb of a lotus.
I became the chief queen of the King of Kāsi,

analyzed: hutvā sakkata pūjitā  ajanim rāja puttāna
translated: worshipped by Sakka,
and gave birth to a full five hundred princes.
When they reached youth,
playing in the water,
seeing the lotus that had fallen,
they were the leaders of the Paccekabuddhas.
I, separated from them,
grieving for the heroes of renown,
after passing away from there,
was reborn in a village on the slopes of Isigili.
When the Buddhas, the most renowned,
of the renowned, and of their teacher,
were going, taking rice gruel,
there were eight Paccekabuddhas.
As I was going to the village for alms,
I saw my children and remembered them;
A stream of milk flowed from my breasts,
at that time my love for my children.
Then with my own hands I gave them rice-gruel,
with a serene mind;
After that I passed away and was reborn in the realm of the Thirty-three,
in Nandana.
Having experienced pleasure and pain,
wandering through existence and becoming;
For as long as I had to, O Great Hero,
I gave up my life.
Thus the many kinds of suffering,
and the many kinds of prosperity;
In my last existence, when I was reborn,
I was born in the city of Sāvatthī.
In a family of great wealth,
happy and well-off,
with various jewels and lamps,
with all desires fulfilled.
Honored, respected,
and likewise revered and esteemed,
Endowed with beauty and excellence,

analyzed: kulesu atisakka tā  atīva patthitā ca asi
translated: highly regarded in the families.🔽I was greatly desired
for my beauty, wealth, and glory;
I was desired by many hundreds
of sons of merchants.
Having left the home life,
I went forth into homelessness;
Before half a month had passed,
I reached the four noble truths.
Having manifested through psychic power,
I, a four-wheeled chariot,
I will pay homage at the feet of the Buddha,
The protector of the world, the one with suchness.
‘Having gone to a tree with blossoming top,
You stand alone at the foot of a sala tree;

original: Na cāpi te dutiyo atthi koci,
analyzed: na ca api te dutiyaḥ atthi koci
translated: And you have no second at all,
Fool, are you not afraid of the ascetics?’
‘Even a hundred thousand ascetics like you,
Having come together, would be like this;
My hair would not bristle, nor would I tremble,

original: Kiṁ me tuvaṁ māra karissaseko.🔽Esā antaradhāyāmi,
analyzed: kim me tuvam māra karissasekaḥ  esā antaradhāyāmi
translated: What can you do to me, Mara?🔽I will disappear,
Or enter into your belly;
Even in the middle of your mouth,

analyzed: tiṭṭhantim mama na dakkhasi  cittasmin vasībhūtā amhi
translated: You will not see me standing.🔽I have mastery over the mind,
The bases of psychic power are well developed;
I am free from all bonds,
I am not afraid of you, friend.
Sensual pleasures are like a sword and stake,
The aggregates are a saw for cutting up;
What you call sensual pleasure,
That is now a displeasure to me.
Everywhere delight is destroyed,
The mass of darkness is shattered;
Know this, O Evil One,
You are defeated, O Death!”
The Victor, being satisfied with that quality,
placed me at the head of those with psychic power;
“Foremost among those with psychic power,”
the leader of the assembly said.
I have attended on the Teacher,
I have done what the Buddha asked;
The heavy burden has been put down,
the net of views has been destroyed.
For the sake of which I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
that purpose has been accomplished,
the destruction of all the fetters.🔽The robe, alms-food,

analyzed: cīvaram piṇḍapātam ca  paccayam sayana āsana
translated: requisites and lodging,
they bring them in an instant,
from all around in their thousands.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus spoke the nun Uppalavaṇṇā, and the Teacher said: “Good, good, Uppalavaṇṇā!”
The Story of the Elder Nun Uppalavaṇṇā is finished.
